column4: Can someone help me? im trying to install ubuntu 11.10. It freezes when trying to boot
Can someone help me? im trying to install ubuntu 11.10. It freezes when trying to boot
yes i have an nvidia card, and yes i checked the md5sum
i really dont know what do answer about where it freezes
do you get to the plymouth splash ?
or not even there ?
I see a purple screen with icons in bottom, then command lines weird command lines in purple background and freeze
press the up key at the purplre (plymouth ) screen any errors ?
you can boot live cd ??
then mount and chroot
i tried using a USB stick with live cd, i got errors there as well
I'm using 64bit, does this do any difference?
64 host ? and live cd ? is it installed then wont boot or live just wont boot
try a 32bit  just for now
so we can look seper Bob knows nothing about windows
i tried using pendrivelinux to run ubuntu 11.10 32bit, in the menu i chose ubuntu live. I now get this error: udevd[103]: timeout: killing ' sbin/modprobe -bv pci: v000000...  same as before i think
looks like this ? https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/udev/+bug/818177
what can i do about this bug i apparently get?
what can i do about this bug i apparently get?
look at post # 17
